results.title: Bachelor Girl
results.creator_credit: Yarra Bank Films, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission, Ned Lander and Rivka Hartman
results.brief_description: Dot (Lyn Pierse) is a modern, confident, single woman who writes for a local soap. Content with single life, Dot finds a number of ways to fend off her mother who desperately tries to ‘hook her up’ with various migrating male folk, but Dot is summoned by the boss at the eleventh hour to save a failing plotline… As she and the crew hash-out potential scenarios her personal life escalates in Romance. But will love continue to bloom or will the fanciful story take-over? Contains footage of Melbourne (St.Kilda, Royal Botanic Gardens, Brighton Beach and Victoria Market). Cast includes: Kim Gyngell, Bruce Spence, Jan Friedl, Doug Tremlett, Ruth Yaffe, Jane Turner, Tim Robertson, Mark Minchinton, Mark Little, John Flaus and Lynda Gibson.

results.title: Bachdisc
results.brief_description: The Bachdisc marks a milestone in the treatment of musical subjects in laserdisc format. How does one add visually to something that is not only heard, but is considered to be the most subjective of the arts? Bachdisc creator, Juan Downey, incorporates onto a multiple-image screen various images of the famous New York harpsichordist Elaine Comparone playing Bach’s Fugue #24 in B minor. On side 2 of the disc is a documentary of Bach’s personal life and work.

results.title: Bach flower remedies: a further understanding
results.brief_description: The Bach Flower Remedies represent a system of healing for the personality and temperament. Their purpose is to help to re-establish emotional equilibrium and thus act as an aid to one’s own natural healing. This interesting and informative video gives a general guide to Dr Edward Bach’s flower remedies. Bach believed that the real cause of an illness was the mental state or temperament of the patient and not the condition of their body. Using flowers from plants and trees, Bach had, by the time of his death, discovered 38 remedies which he divided into seven groups: fear; uncertainty; insufficient interest in present circumstances; loneliness; over-sensitivity to influence and ideas; despondency or despair; over care for the welfare of others. Filmed at Mount Vernon, the cottage in Oxfordshire where Dr Edward Bach spent the last years of his life, Brenda Longman (presenter and narrator) discusses various aspects of the remedies with John Ramsell and Judy Howard (trustees and curators of Mount Vernon) including a demonstration in making up the remedies, the process of determining the right remedy for a particular type of person, self-help advice and examples of remedies for depression and anger. A recommended reading list is provided at the end of the program.

results.title: Baby story
results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto Films and Bruno Bozzetto
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s animated comic version of life in the womb. Illustrates the struggle of the sperm to fertilise the ovum when opposed by contraceptives.

results.title: Baby care: feeding
results.creator_credit: Pennsylvania State College Productions, Irving C. Boerlin and Paul H Seilzinger
results.brief_description: The steps necessary when prepapring to feed an infant are dealt with in detail, with stress on the importance of cleanliness and exactness. (Deals mainly with artificial feeding).

results.title: Baby animals
results.brief_description: A number of simple scientific facts about baby animals are presented in such a way as to be suitable for children of kindergarten age, including: mother deer taking care of her young; pelicans from birth, skunk taking care of yer young; a baby racoon’s first trip to the river and an oppossum carrying its young up a tree.

results.title: Baby and the bottle
results.creator_credit: Cambridge FIlm T V Productions and David Bilcock
results.brief_description: This film describes and demonstrates the bottle feeding of a baby. It points out important details which must be observed to ensure satisfactory feeding and demonstrates preparation and sterilization methods, including terminal sterilization whereby several bottles can be prepared and stored for future use.

results.title: Baboons
results.brief_description: Part of a series called “Zoo animals in the wild”, this film shows the baboon travelling in troops, looking for food and caring for its young. Suitable for mid-upper Primary school. No other credits available.
